intro: Ainsliaea crassifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It features opposite, ovate leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
